name: Understanding Emails from PhishER
title: Understanding Emails from PhishER
body:
Did you receive an email like the one displayed below and wonder what it is? Fear not! This email is actually from an admin in your organization.

What You Need to Know

A simulated email is from a KnowBe4 Phishing Security Test sent from your organization, while any other email is considered non-simulated. When you report a non-simulated email with the Phish Alert Button (PAB), a copy is forwarded to your admins for review in their PhishER console.

Once your admin reviews the reported email, they may send you a message like the one displayed above. Any responses you send to these emails are sent back to your PhishER admins for review and are treated like direct messages so that they can respond in real time!

If you have any questions or concerns, contact your internal IT team or our support team.

images.alt:
This image displays a system-generated email notification from the **PhishER Discussion Panel** (<discussions@phisher.knowbe4.com>), dated **Mon, Apr 28, 4:58 PM**.

**Context and Content:**
The email notifies the recipient that a PhishER administrator has responded to a user comment regarding a specific reported phishing message.

The body text includes:
1.  **Notification:** "A PhishER admin, [Admin identifier, partially obscured], has responded to your comment on the reported message, 'Urgent: Sign in to your Google Account if you want to keep it'." (The quoted text is the subject/content of the original reported message.)
2.  **Admin's Comment:** "Great job reporting this email!"
3.  **Action Prompt:** "You can reply to this email to add a comment."

**UI Elements:**
The email header displays the sender name, sender address, recipient ("to me"), and standard email controls on the top right (Star/Favorite icon, Reply/Undo arrow, and three-dot More Options icon).
images.context: (PAB), a copy is forwarded to your admins for review in their PhishER console.
